attributes.action: Prevent the construction of a  local housing development
attributes.additional_details:
2.33 page 12 on The Framework Travel Plan it states that  "A new bus service is also being proposed to connect into the site".If this is to happen we may see a rise in council tax to pay for the bus service

 2.30 Page 11 on The Framework Travel Plan  incorrectly states that "In total these services provide on average eight buses per hour".This is false;evidence can be provided  if requested.

Evidence of the proposed site being used for recreational activities can be provided if requested.
attributes.background: The proposed site is a regular recreational area for families.If the proposed site is granted planning permission the crime rate will increase ,house prices will decrease,local services will be of a lower quality for existing residents and new residents shall cause further mass congestion.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
